item.title: Last Of Us Studio Reveals Next Game And It's A Sci-Fi Bounty Hunter Adventure
item.content:encoded:
https://kotaku.com/naughty-dog-last-of-us-intergalatic-trailer-game-awards-1851720381

The Game Awards ended with a big finale, a new trailer revealing Naughty Dog’s next game. It’s called Intergalactic: The Heretic Prophet and it looks really, really cool and stylish, mixing lo-fi tech and sci-fi bounty hunters.

  • Off
  • English

Suggested Reading

Here’s the trailer:

Intergalactic appears to be set in the future in a totally original universe. In the stylish trailer we see a woman who seems to be a bounty hunter. She drives a hot red Porsche-branded spaceship that is filled with retro, low-fi technology, including a CD player that she uses later in the video to play some Pet Shop Boys. (Good to see great music lives on in the future.)

Here’s the official description of the game:

Intergalactic: The Heretic Prophet is the newest franchise in development for the PlayStation 5 console from Naughty Dog, the studio behind acclaimed series like The Last of Us and UNCHARTED.

Set thousands of years in the future, Intergalactic puts players into the role of Jordan A. Mun, a dangerous bounty hunter who ends up stranded on Sempiria – a distant planet whose communication with the outside universe went dark hundreds of years ago. Jordan will have to use all her skills and wits if she hopes to be the first person in over 600 years to leave its orbit.

According to Geoff, the game has been in development since 2020 and will feature a soundtrack from Trent Reznor and Atticus Ross. Neil Druckmann is directing Intergalactic. The game is being published by PlayStation.

We knew that Naughty Dog was working on something new. In November, Druckmann, who directed Last of Us Part II and helped develop the hit HBO TV show adaptation of the first game, confirmed that he had been leading development on a new game since 2020. It seems that he was hinting at Intergalactic: The Heretic Prophet.

item.title: The Best Part Of The Game Awards Were These Two Bastards
item.content:encoded:
https://kotaku.com/the-game-awards-2024-geoff-muppets-statler-waldorf-1851720364

During tonight’s Game Awards, a lot of big games were announced and a long list of awards were handed out. And that was all fine. There were even some really exciting surprises that I liked. But the best part of the show by far was whenever Statler and Waldorf from The Muppets showed up to heckle host Geoff Keighley and mock the whole affair.

Suggested Reading

Live Forever in the Universe of 'New World: Aeternum'

Suggested Reading

Characters from The Muppets have appeared at past Game Awards shows, but this year, to celebrate the 10 year anniversary of Geoff Keighley’s yearly trailer-thon (with some awards interrupting the commercials), he invited Statler and Waldorf. And if you were worried that these two incorrigible hecklers would not be allowed to rip apart the show, Geoff, and everything else, don’t be. These two famous Muppet insult comics were on fire tonight and provided the biggest laughs and best moments during this year’s very long Game Awards event.

Here is their first appearance early on in the show:

After noticing some empty seats in the theater they had this to say to Geoff: “We heard you always sell out!”

When talking about how the Game Awards is turning 10 years old, they joked about Geoff hosting it, saying: “How long is this bozo gonna go on? Well that’s what I’ve been asking for 10 years!”

During another appearance, the two of them begged for all the commercials to stop and asked someone to help them. That part was very relatable for all the writers and reporters covering this show all night. It was all very good stuff.

But perhaps the best part came when they joked about Geoff and his friend, Metal Gear creator Hideo Kojima. The thing is, I know that Geoff is a massive Muppets fan, so he was loving every moment of this.

Not sure if Kojima was a fan, though...Here’s the moment via Kotaku reporter Ethan Gach:

Anyway, I suggest that these two be invited to every video game event and convention. And kudos to Geoff for letting them dunk on him and the show like that.
